titleStmt.title: Refractoria disputatio: or, The thwarting conference, in a discourse between [brace] Thraso, one of the late Kings colonels. Neutralis, a sojourner in the city. Prelaticus, a chaplain to the late King. Patriotus, a well-willer to the Parliament. All of them differently affected, and disputing on the subjects inserted after the epistle, on the dissolution of the late Parliament, and other changes of state.
titleStmt.author: T. L. W.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Robert White, and are to be sold by Thomas Brewster at the three Bibles in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: "Thraso, .. to the Parliament." bracketed on title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the three Bibles in Pauls Church-yard
